Posted By: lorendorky (6/30/2011 10:20:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm giving Windfall a 5/5 Why?  
  
Hand-cycling is the core and foundation my [Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind) EDH deck. And in that deck, Windfall is a star player.  
  
Hand-cycling in and of itself is very powerful, under-utilized, and under-rated. It allows you to cycle through your deck and play the cards you need at that specific point in the game. At its best it's almost like having your whole deck in your hand at once (and many times you actually do).  
  
So what's so great about Windfall?   
  
There are two distinct types of hand-cycling. Draw 7 and replacement.   
  
The draw 7's allow you to refill your hand quickly after casting a bunch of spells. They are excellent cards to have in your starting hand and very nice early draws (the cheaper ones). In addition to refilling your own hand, they tend to screw up your opponents carefully mulliganed and tutored hands. They aren't so great in late game because you'll already have a large hand. Without Sphinx in play you will be netting... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Mudbutt_on (5/27/2012 1:06:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Windfall is one of The Best 'draw cards' effects in the game- yet, it's two-sided, and while it certainly allows shenanigans in any deck that can touch its own graveyard (graveyard manipulation is best when you can hit your own as well, relying on your opponent's graveyard for anything other than Tarmogoyf is probably not a safe gamble), at the same time, it seems pretty well balanced- Not an Instant, and OUTSIDE shenanigans, 'really big Loot' is fair *and* cool.
  
   
M12 brought us this ability on a stick at Rare- actually, that card is a little worse than this because in addition to being countered, creatures' abilities can be turned off, and they can be killed, forced to block, fight, exiled...oh [Jace's Archivist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Archivist) is good, but it's not what they call ''consistent''.
  
   
I have a dangerous question: Is Windfall safe to put on a Planeswalker? NOT for 0, obviously- but- maybe for -2? -3? I liked the idea of a tricky, not-just Draw ability on a Planeswalker when J... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

M12 brought us this ability on a stick at Rare- actually, that card is a little worse than this because in addition to being countered, creatures' abilities can be turned off, and they can be killed, forced to block, fight, exiled...oh Jace's Archivist is good, but it's not what they call ''consistent''.

I have a dangerous question: Is Windfall safe to put on a Planeswalker? NOT for 0, obviously- but- maybe for -2? -3? I liked the idea of a tricky, not-just Draw ability on a Planeswalker when J... (see all)
